comments: When using value_format DELIMITED, we can define VALUE_DELIMITER as custom character or
one of the formats in org.apache.commons.csv.CSVFormat
Supported value DEFAULT, EXCEL, INFORMIX_UNLOAD, INFORMIX_UNLOAD_CSV, MYSQL, RFC4180, ORACLE, POSTGRESQL_CSV,

tests.name: select delimited value_format
statements: CREATE STREAM TEST (ID bigint, NAME varchar, VALUE integer) WITH (kafka_topic='test_topic', value_format='DELIMITED');
CREATE STREAM S2 as SELECT id, name, value FROM test;

tests.name: select delimited value_format with tab separated values using CsvFormat constant
statements: CREATE STREAM TEST (ID bigint, NAME varchar, VALUE integer) WITH (kafka_topic='test_topic', value_format='DELIMITED', value_delimiter='TDF');
CREATE STREAM S2 as SELECT id, name, value FROM test;

tests.name: select delimited value_format with tab separated values using custom delimiter character
statements: CREATE STREAM TEST (ID bigint, NAME varchar, VALUE integer) WITH (kafka_topic='test_topic', value_format='DELIMITED', value_delimiter='	');
CREATE STREAM S2 as SELECT id, name, value FROM test;

tests.name: select delimited value_format with pipe separated values using custom delimiter character
statements: CREATE STREAM TEST (ID bigint, NAME varchar, VALUE integer) WITH (kafka_topic='test_topic', value_format='DELIMITED', value_delimiter='|');
CREATE STREAM S2 as SELECT id, name, value FROM test;
